Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the speculation that the man intentionally dropped currency notes to spread the coronavirus infection. There is no evidence or confirmation to support this speculation.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on speculation and assumptions without any concrete evidence.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the man dropped the note intentionally to spread the coronavirus infection, without considering alternative explanations or possibilities.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's investigation revealed an alternative explanation for the incident, stating that the man's right hand is paralyzed and the notes fell out of his hand accidentally. This alternative explanation challenges the assumption made in the claim.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
Contradict fact: There is no evidence of contradicting facts in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times in the provided information.
